databases.description:
Provisions an RDS Aurora cluster for MySQL or Postgres. Supports Amazon Aurora Serverless. Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-rds-cluster/1.4.0 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/databases.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description: Whether to enable Activity Streams
sections.title: activity_stream_enabled

sections.description:
The ARN for the KMS key to encrypt Activity Stream Data data.

When specifying `activity_stream_kms_key_id`, `activity_stream_enabled` needs to be set to true
sections.title: activity_stream_kms_key_id

sections.description:
The mode for the Activity Streams.

`async` and `sync` are supported.

Defaults to `async`
sections.title: activity_stream_mode

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description:
Password for the master DB user.

Ignored if snapshot_identifier or replication_source_identifier is provided
sections.title: admin_password

sections.description:
Username for the master DB user.

Ignored if snapshot_identifier or replication_source_identifier is provided
sections.title: admin_user

sections.description: The allocated storage in GBs
sections.title: allocated_storage

sections.description:
Enable to allow major engine version upgrades when changing engine versions.

Defaults to false.
sections.title: allow_major_version_upgrade

sections.description: List of CIDR blocks allowed to access the cluster
sections.title: allowed_cidr_blocks

sections.description: Specifies whether any cluster modifications are applied immediately, or during the next maintenance window
sections.title: apply_immediately

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description: Indicates that minor engine upgrades will be applied automatically to the DB instance during the maintenance window
sections.title: auto_minor_version_upgrade

sections.description: Whether to enable cluster autoscaling
sections.title: autoscaling_enabled

sections.description: Maximum number of instances to be maintained by the autoscaler
sections.title: autoscaling_max_capacity

sections.description: Minimum number of instances to be maintained by the autoscaler
sections.title: autoscaling_min_capacity

sections.description:
Autoscaling policy type.

`TargetTrackingScaling` and `StepScaling` are supported
sections.title: autoscaling_policy_type

sections.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling down activity can start.

Default is 300s
sections.title: autoscaling_scale_in_cooldown

sections.description:
The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes and before the next scaling up activity can start.

Default is 300s
sections.title: autoscaling_scale_out_cooldown

sections.description:
The metrics type to use.

If this value isn't provided the default is CPU utilization
sections.title: autoscaling_target_metrics

sections.description: The target value to scale with respect to target metrics
sections.title: autoscaling_target_value

sections.description:
The target backtrack window, in seconds.

Only available for aurora engine currently.

Must be between 0 and 259200 (72 hours)
sections.title: backtrack_window

sections.description: Daily time range during which the backups happen
sections.title: backup_window

sections.description: The identifier of the CA certificate for the DB instance
sections.title: ca_cert_identifier

sections.description:
Name of the cluster CNAME record to create in the parent DNS zone specified by `zone_id`.

If left empty, the name will be auto-asigned using the format `master.var.name`
sections.title: cluster_dns_name

sections.description: The family of the DB cluster parameter group
sections.title: cluster_family

sections.description:
The RDS Cluster Identifier.

Will use generated label ID if not supplied
sections.title: cluster_identifier

sections.description: List of DB cluster parameters to apply

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: cluster_parameters

sections.description: Number of DB instances to create in the cluster
sections.title: cluster_size

sections.description:
Either `regional` or `global`.

If `regional` will be created as a normal, standalone DB.

If `global`, will be made part of a Global cluster (requires `global_cluster_identifier`).
sections.title: cluster_type

sections.description: Copy tags to backup snapshots
sections.title: copy_tags_to_snapshot

sections.description: This setting is required to create a provisioned Multi-AZ DB cluster
sections.title: db_cluster_instance_class

sections.description: Database name (default is not to create a database)
sections.title: db_name

sections.description: Database port
sections.title: db_port

sections.description: If the DB instance should have deletion protection enabled
sections.title: deletion_protection

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Whether or not to apply the egress security group rule to default security group, defaults to `true`
sections.title: egress_enabled

sections.description:
Enable HTTP endpoint (data API).

Only valid when engine_mode is set to serverless
sections.title: enable_http_endpoint

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description:
List of log types to export to cloudwatch.

The following log types are supported: audit, error, general, slowquery
sections.title: enabled_cloudwatch_logs_exports

sections.description:
The name of the database engine to be used for this DB cluster.

Valid values: `aurora`, `aurora-mysql`, `aurora-postgresql`
sections.title: engine

sections.description:
The database engine mode.

Valid values: `parallelquery`, `provisioned`, `serverless`
sections.title: engine_mode

sections.description:
The version of the database engine to use.

See `aws rds describe-db-engine-versions`
sections.title: engine_version

sections.description: The attributes for the enhanced monitoring IAM role
sections.title: enhanced_monitoring_attributes

sections.description:
A boolean flag to enable/disable the creation of the enhanced monitoring IAM role.

If set to `false`, the module will not create a new role and will use `rds_monitoring_role_arn` for enhanced monitoring
sections.title: enhanced_monitoring_role_enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description: Extensions to load into the database
sections.title: extensions

sections.description: ID of the Aurora global cluster
sections.title: global_cluster_identifier

sections.description: Specifies whether or mappings of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled
sections.title: iam_database_authentication_enabled

sections.description: Iam roles for the Aurora cluster
sections.title: iam_roles

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description:
Optional parameter to place cluster instances in a specific availability zone.

If left empty, will place randomly
sections.title: instance_availability_zone

sections.description: List of DB instance parameters to apply

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: instance_parameters

sections.description: Instance type to use
sections.title: instance_type

sections.description: Whether to allow traffic between resources inside the database's security group.
sections.title: intra_security_group_traffic_enabled

sections.description:
The amount of provisioned IOPS.

Setting this implies a storage_type of 'io1'.

This setting is required to create a Multi-AZ DB cluster.

Check TF docs for values based on db engine
sections.title: iops

sections.description:
The ARN for the KMS encryption key.

When specifying `kms_key_arn`, `storage_encrypted` needs to be set to `true`
sections.title: kms_key_arn

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description: Weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in UTC
sections.title: maintenance_window

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description: Whether to enable Performance Insights
sections.title: performance_insights_enabled

sections.description:
The ARN for the KMS key to encrypt Performance Insights data.

When specifying `performance_insights_kms_key_id`, `performance_insights_enabled` needs to be set to true
sections.title: performance_insights_kms_key_id

sections.description:
Amount of time in days to retain Performance Insights data.

Either 7 (7 days) or 731 (2 years)
sections.title: performance_insights_retention_period

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description: Set to true if you want your cluster to be publicly accessible (such as via QuickSight)
sections.title: publicly_accessible

sections.description:
The interval, in seconds, between points when enhanced monitoring metrics are collected for the DB instance.

To disable collecting Enhanced Monitoring metrics, specify 0.

The default is 0.

Valid Values: 0, 1, 5, 10, 15, 30, 60
sections.title: rds_monitoring_interval

sections.description: The ARN for the IAM role that permits RDS to send enhanced monitoring metrics to CloudWatch Logs
sections.title: rds_monitoring_role_arn

sections.description:
Name of the reader endpoint CNAME record to create in the parent DNS zone specified by `zone_id`.

If left empty, the name will be auto-asigned using the format `replicas.var.name`
sections.title: reader_dns_name

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description: ARN of a source DB cluster or DB instance if this DB cluster is to be created as a Read Replica
sections.title: replication_source_identifier

sections.description:
List point-in-time recovery options.

Only valid actions are `source_cluster_identifier`, `restore_type` and `use_latest_restorable_time`

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: restore_to_point_in_time

sections.description: Number of days to retain backups for
sections.title: retention_period

sections.description:
Restore from a Percona Xtrabackup in S3.

The `bucket_name` is required to be in the same region as the resource.

snippets.content:
optional(object({
bucket_name = optional(string)
bucket_prefix = optional(string)
ingestion_role = optional(string)
source_engine = optional(string)
source_engine_version = optional(string)
}))
snippets.title: Type

sections.title: s3_import

sections.description:
List of nested attributes with scaling properties.

Only valid when `engine_mode` is set to `serverless`

snippets.content:
optional(list(object({
auto_pause = optional(bool)
max_capacity = optional(number)
min_capacity = optional(number)
seconds_until_auto_pause = optional(number)
timeout_action = optional(string)
})))
snippets.title: Type

sections.title: scaling_configuration

sections.description: List of security groups to be allowed to connect to the DB instance
sections.title: security_groups

sections.description: serverlessv2 scaling properties
sections.title: serverlessv2_scaling_configuration

sections.description: Shared preload libraries to use for cluster and database parameter groups
sections.title: shared_preload_libraries

sections.description: Determines whether a final DB snapshot is created before the DB cluster is deleted
sections.title: skip_final_snapshot

sections.description: Specifies whether or not to create this cluster from a snapshot
sections.title: snapshot_identifier

sections.description: Source Region of primary cluster, needed when using encrypted storage and region replicas
sections.title: source_region

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'
sections.title: stage

sections.description:
Specifies whether the DB cluster is encrypted.

The default is `false` for `provisioned` `engine_mode` and `true` for `serverless` `engine_mode`
sections.title: storage_encrypted

sections.description: One of 'standard' (magnetic), 'gp2' (general purpose SSD), or 'io1' (provisioned IOPS SSD)
sections.title: storage_type

sections.description:
Database subnet group name.

Will use generated label ID if not supplied.
sections.title: subnet_group_name

sections.description: List of VPC subnet IDs
sections.title: subnets

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

snippets.content: { for k, v in merge(local.tags, lookup(|DATA_SINK|, "tags", {})) : k => v if k != "Name" }
snippets.title: Override

sections.title: tags

sections.description:
ID element _(Rarely used, not included by default)_.

A customer identifier, indicating who this instance of a resource is for
sections.title: tenant

sections.description:
List of timeout values per action.

Only valid actions are `create`, `update` and `delete`

snippets.title: Type

sections.title: timeouts_configuration

sections.description: VPC ID to create the cluster in (e.g. `vpc-a22222ee`)
sections.title: vpc_id

sections.description: Additional security group IDs to apply to the cluster, in addition to the provisioned default security group with ingress traffic from existing CIDR blocks and existing security groups
sections.title: vpc_security_group_ids

sections.description:
Route53 DNS Zone ID as list of string (0 or 1 items).

If empty, no custom DNS name will be published.

If the list contains a single Zone ID, a custom DNS name will be pulished in that zone.

Can also be a plain string, but that use is DEPRECATED because of Terraform issues.
sections.title: zone_id

databases.title: Configuration

dynamodb_tables.description:
Provisions a DynamoDB table with autoscaling. Autoscaler scales up/down the provisioned OPS for the DynamoDB table based on the load. Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-dynamodb/0.32.0 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/dynamodb_tables.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description: DynamoDB autoscaling max read capacity
sections.title: autoscale_max_read_capacity

sections.description: DynamoDB autoscaling max write capacity
sections.title: autoscale_max_write_capacity

sections.description: DynamoDB autoscaling min read capacity
sections.title: autoscale_min_read_capacity

sections.description: DynamoDB autoscaling min write capacity
sections.title: autoscale_min_write_capacity

sections.description: The target value (in %) for DynamoDB read autoscaling
sections.title: autoscale_read_target

sections.description: The target value (in %) for DynamoDB write autoscaling
sections.title: autoscale_write_target

sections.description: Additional attributes for the autoscaler module
sections.title: autoscaler_attributes

sections.description: Additional resource tags for the autoscaler module
sections.title: autoscaler_tags

sections.description:
DynamoDB Billing mode.

Can be PROVISIONED or PAY_PER_REQUEST
sections.title: billing_mode

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Additional DynamoDB attributes in the form of a list of mapped values
sections.title: dynamodb_attributes

sections.description: Flag to enable/disable DynamoDB autoscaling
sections.title: enable_autoscaler

sections.description: Enable DynamoDB server-side encryption
sections.title: enable_encryption

sections.description: Enable DynamoDB point in time recovery
sections.title: enable_point_in_time_recovery

sections.description: Enable DynamoDB streams
sections.title: enable_streams

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description: Additional global secondary indexes in the form of a list of mapped values

snippets.content:
optional(list(object({
hash_key = optional(string)
name = optional(string)
non_key_attributes = optional(list(string))
projection_type = optional(string)
range_key = optional(string)
read_capacity = optional(number)
write_capacity = optional(number)
})))

sections.description: DynamoDB table Hash Key
sections.title: hash_key

sections.description: Hash Key type, which must be a scalar type: `S`, `N`, or `B` for (S)tring, (N)umber or (B)inary data
sections.title: hash_key_type

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description: Additional local secondary indexes in the form of a list of mapped values

sections.title: local_secondary_index_map

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description: DynamoDB table Range Key
sections.title: range_key

sections.description: Range Key type, which must be a scalar type: `S`, `N`, or `B` for (S)tring, (N)umber or (B)inary data
sections.title: range_key_type

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description: List of regions to create replica
sections.title: replicas

sections.description:
The ARN of the CMK that should be used for the AWS KMS encryption.

This attribute should only be specified if the key is different from the default DynamoDB CMK, alias/aws/dynamodb.
sections.title: server_side_encryption_kms_key_arn

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'

sections.description: When an item in the table is modified, what information is written to the stream
sections.title: stream_view_type

sections.description:
DynamoDB storage class of the table.

Can be STANDARD or STANDARD_INFREQUENT_ACCESS
sections.title: table_class

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

Set to `false` to disable tagging.

dynamodb_tables.title: Configuration

elasticache_redis.description:
Provisions an ElastiCache Redis Cluster Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-elasticache-redis/0.50.0 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/elasticache_redis.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description:
A list of Security Group rule objects to add to the created security group, in addition to the ones

this module normally creates.

(To suppress the module's rules, set `create_security_group` to false

and supply your own security group via `associated_security_group_ids`.)

The keys and values of the objects are fully compatible with the `aws_security_group_rule` resource, except

for `security_group_id` which will be ignored, and the optional "key" which, if provided, must be unique and known at "plan" time.

To get more info see https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/security_group_rule .
sections.title: additional_security_group_rules

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description: Alarm action list
sections.title: alarm_actions

sections.description: CPU threshold alarm level
sections.title: alarm_cpu_threshold_percent

sections.description: Ram threshold alarm level
sections.title: alarm_memory_threshold_bytes

sections.description:
If `true`, the created security group will allow egress on all ports and protocols to all IP address.

If this is false and no egress rules are otherwise specified, then no egress will be allowed.

Defaults to `true` unless the deprecated `egress_cidr_blocks` is provided and is not `["0.0.0.0/0"]`, in which case defaults to `false`.
sections.title: allow_all_egress

sections.description: A list of IDs of Security Groups to allow access to the security group created by this module.
sections.title: allowed_security_group_ids

sections.description: Apply changes immediately
sections.title: apply_immediately

sections.description:
A list of IDs of Security Groups to associate the created resource with, in addition to the created security group.

These security groups will not be modified and, if `create_security_group` is `false`, must provide all the required access.
sections.title: associated_security_group_ids

sections.description: Enable encryption at rest
sections.title: at_rest_encryption_enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description:
Auth token for password protecting redis, `transit_encryption_enabled` must be set to `true`.

Password must be longer than 16 chars
sections.title: auth_token

sections.description:
Specifies whether minor version engine upgrades will be applied automatically to the underlying Cache Cluster instances during the maintenance window.

Only supported if the engine version is 6 or higher.
sections.title: auto_minor_version_upgrade

sections.description: Automatic failover (Not available for T1/T2 instances)
sections.title: automatic_failover_enabled

sections.description: Availability zone IDs
sections.title: availability_zones

sections.description: Boolean flag to enable/disable CloudWatch metrics alarms
sections.title: cloudwatch_metric_alarms_enabled

sections.description:
Flag to enable/disable creation of a native redis cluster.

`automatic_failover_enabled` must be set to `true`.

Only 1 `cluster_mode` block is allowed
sections.title: cluster_mode_enabled

sections.description:
Number of node groups (shards) for this Redis replication group.

Changing this number will trigger an online resizing operation before other settings modifications
sections.title: cluster_mode_num_node_groups

sections.description:
Number of replica nodes in each node group.

Valid values are 0 to 5.

Changing this number will force a new resource
sections.title: cluster_mode_replicas_per_node_group

sections.description:
Number of nodes in cluster.

*Ignored when `cluster_mode_enabled` == `true`*
sections.title: cluster_size

sections.description:
Set `true` to create and configure a new security group.

If false, `associated_security_group_ids` must be provided.
sections.title: create_security_group

sections.description:
Enables data tiering.

Data tiering is only supported for replication groups using the r6gd node type.
sections.title: data_tiering_enabled

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Description of elasticache replication group
sections.title: description

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description:
The subdomain to use for the CNAME record.

If not provided then the CNAME record will use var.name.
sections.title: dns_subdomain

sections.description: Subnet group name for the ElastiCache instance
sections.title: elasticache_subnet_group_name

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description: Redis engine version
sections.title: engine_version

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description: Redis family
sections.title: family

sections.description:
The name of your final node group (shard) snapshot.

ElastiCache creates the snapshot from the primary node in the cluster.

If omitted, no final snapshot will be made.
sections.title: final_snapshot_identifier

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description: Elastic cache instance type
sections.title: instance_type

sections.description:
The ARN of the key that you wish to use if encrypting at rest.

If not supplied, uses service managed encryption.

`at_rest_encryption_enabled` must be set to `true`
sections.title: kms_key_id

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description:
The log_delivery_configuration block allows the streaming of Redis SLOWLOG or Redis Engine Log to CloudWatch Logs or Kinesis Data Firehose.

Max of 2 blocks.
sections.title: log_delivery_configuration

sections.description: Maintenance window
sections.title: maintenance_window

sections.description:
Multi AZ (Automatic Failover must also be enabled.

 If Cluster Mode is enabled, Multi AZ is on by default, and this setting is ignored)
sections.title: multi_az_enabled

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

This is the only ID element not also included as a `tag`.

The "name" tag is set to the full `id` string.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
sections.title: name

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually an abbreviation of your organization name, e.g. 'eg' or 'cp', to help ensure generated IDs are globally unique
sections.title: namespace

sections.description:
Optional map of accounts to a corresponding spoke VPC network name within the account.

Use the network name from the Transit Gateway, not the VPC name itself, e.g. cluster_Clusters_Prod.
sections.title: network_map

sections.description: Notification topic arn
sections.title: notification_topic_arn

sections.description:
The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an OK state from any other state.

Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Number (ARN)
sections.title: ok_actions

sections.description:
A list of Redis parameters to apply.

Note that parameters may differ from one Redis family to another
sections.title: parameter

sections.description: Managed by Terraform
sections.title: parameter_group_description

sections.description: Redis port
sections.title: port

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for private Intranet access
sections.title: private

sections.description: Whether to build an instance of the module for public Internet access
sections.title: public

sections.description:
Terraform regular expression (regex) string.

Characters matching the regex will be removed from the ID elements.

If not set, `"/[^a-zA-Z0-9-]/"` is used to remove all characters other than hyphens, letters and digits.
sections.title: regex_replace_chars

sections.description:
Replication group ID with the following constraints: \nA name must contain from 1 to 20 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

\n The first character must be a letter.

\n A name cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
sections.title: replication_group_id

sections.description:
Set `true` to enable Terraform `create_before_destroy` behavior on the created security group.

We only recommend setting this `false` if you are upgrading this module and need to keep

the existing security group from being replaced.

Note that changing this value will always cause the security group to be replaced.
sections.title: security_group_create_before_destroy

sections.description: How long to wait for the security group to be created.
sections.title: security_group_create_timeout

sections.description: How long to retry on `DependencyViolation` errors during security group deletion.
sections.title: security_group_delete_timeout

sections.description:
The description to assign to the created Security Group.

Warning: Changing the description causes the security group to be replaced.

Set this to `null` to maintain parity with releases <= `0.34.0`.
sections.title: security_group_description

sections.description:
The name to assign to the created security group.

Must be unique within the VPC.

If not provided, will be derived from the `null-label.context` passed in.

If `create_before_destroy` is true, will be used as a name prefix.
sections.title: security_group_name

sections.description:
A single-element string list containing an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Redis RDB snapshot file stored in Amazon S3.

Example: arn:aws:s3:::my_bucket/snapshot1.rdb
sections.title: snapshot_arns

sections.description:
The name of a snapshot from which to restore data into the new node group.

Changing the snapshot_name forces a new resource.
sections.title: snapshot_name

sections.description: The number of days for which ElastiCache will retain automatic cache cluster snapshots before deleting them.
sections.title: snapshot_retention_limit

sections.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which ElastiCache will begin taking a daily snapshot of your cache cluster.
sections.title: snapshot_window

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used to indicate role, e.g. 'prod', 'staging', 'source', 'build', 'test', 'deploy', 'release'
sections.title: stage

sections.description: Subnet IDs
sections.title: subnets

sections.description: Additional tags (e.g. {'BusinessUnit': 'XYZ'}). Neither the tag keys nor the tag values will be modified by this module.

snippets.content: { for k, v in merge(local.tags, lookup(|DATA_SINK|, "tags", {})) : k => v if k != "Name" }
snippets.title: Override

sections.title: tags

sections.description:
ID element _(Rarely used, not included by default)_.

A customer identifier, indicating who this instance of a resource is for
sections.title: tenant

sections.description:
Set `true` to enable encryption in transit.

Forced `true` if `var.auth_token` is set.

If this is enabled, use the [following guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonElastiCache/latest/red-ug/in-transit-encryption.html#connect-tls) to access redis.
sections.title: transit_encryption_enabled

sections.description: User Group ID to associate with the replication group
sections.title: user_group_ids

sections.description: VPC ID
sections.title: vpc_id

sections.description:
Route53 DNS Zone ID as list of string (0 or 1 items).

If empty, no custom DNS name will be published.

If the list contains a single Zone ID, a custom DNS name will be pulished in that zone.

Can also be a plain string, but that use is DEPRECATED because of Terraform issues.
sections.title: zone_id

elasticache_redis.title: Configuration

opensearch.description:
Provisions an Elasticsearch cluster with built-in integrations with Kibana and Logstash. Builds the resources(s) from terraform-aws-elasticsearch/0.36.0 This is done by adding a declaration for the desired asset in ../config/infrastructure/opensearch.yaml. Each parameter may or may not contain any of the following:
Default
Either a default value or a generator used to produce a default value using Terraform
Override
A value or generator that always overrides any value set
Required
Whether the parameter must be set or not
Type
The type of the parameter as dictated by Terraform's types and values documentation
Use the parameters to construct the specification for your asset.

sections.description: Account ID for the module instance
sections.title: account_id

sections.description: AWS accounts where the module instance will be built
sections.title: accounts

sections.description:
Additional key-value pairs to add to each map in `tags_as_list_of_maps`.

Not added to `tags` or `id`.

This is for some rare cases where resources want additional configuration of tags

and therefore take a list of maps with tag key, value, and additional configuration.
sections.title: additional_tag_map

sections.description: Key-value string pairs to specify advanced configuration options
sections.title: advanced_options

sections.description: AWS Elasticsearch Kibana enchanced security plugin enabling (forces new resource)
sections.title: advanced_security_options_enabled

sections.description: Whether to enable or not internal Kibana user database for ELK OpenDistro security plugin
sections.title: advanced_security_options_internal_user_database_enabled

sections.description: ARN of IAM user who is to be mapped to be Kibana master user (applicable if advanced_security_options_internal_user_database_enabled set to false)
sections.title: advanced_security_options_master_user_arn

sections.description: Master user username (applicable if advanced_security_options_internal_user_database_enabled set to true)
sections.title: advanced_security_options_master_user_name

sections.description: Master user password (applicable if advanced_security_options_internal_user_database_enabled set to true)
sections.title: advanced_security_options_master_user_password

sections.description: List of CIDR blocks to be allowed to connect to the cluster
sections.title: allowed_cidr_blocks

sections.description:
ID element.

Additional attributes (e.g. `workers` or `cluster`) to add to `id`,

in the order they appear in the list.

New attributes are appended to the

end of the list.

The elements of the list are joined by the `delimiter`

and treated as a single ID element.
sections.title: attributes

sections.description: Hour at which automated snapshots are taken, in UTC
sections.title: automated_snapshot_start_hour

sections.description: Number of Availability Zones for the domain to use.
sections.title: availability_zone_count

sections.description: AWS EC2 Service Name
sections.title: aws_ec2_service_name

sections.description: Whether to enable Amazon Cognito authentication with Kibana
sections.title: cognito_authentication_enabled

sections.description: ARN of the IAM role that has the AmazonESCognitoAccess policy attached
sections.title: cognito_iam_role_arn

sections.description: The ID of the Cognito Identity Pool to use
sections.title: cognito_identity_pool_id

sections.description: The ID of the Cognito User Pool to use
sections.title: cognito_user_pool_id

sections.description:
Whether to create `AWSServiceRoleForAmazonElasticsearchService` service-linked role.

Set it to `false` if you already have an ElasticSearch cluster created in the AWS account and AWSServiceRoleForAmazonElasticsearchService already exists.

See https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-aws/issues/5218 for more info
sections.title: create_iam_service_linked_role

sections.description: Fully qualified domain for custom endpoint.
sections.title: custom_endpoint

sections.description: ACM certificate ARN for custom endpoint.
sections.title: custom_endpoint_certificate_arn

sections.description: Whether to enable custom endpoint for the Elasticsearch domain.
sections.title: custom_endpoint_enabled

sections.description: Number of dedicated master nodes in the cluster
sections.title: dedicated_master_count

sections.description: Indicates whether dedicated master nodes are enabled for the cluster
sections.title: dedicated_master_enabled

sections.description: Instance type of the dedicated master nodes in the cluster
sections.title: dedicated_master_type

sections.description:
Delimiter to be used between ID elements.

Defaults to `-` (hyphen).

Set to `""` to use no delimiter at all.
sections.title: delimiter

sections.description: Describe additional descriptors to be output in the `descriptors` output map. Map of maps. Keys are names of descriptors. Values are maps of the form { format = string labels = list(string) } (Type is `any` so the map values can later be enhanced to provide additional options.) `format` is a Terraform format string to be passed to the `format()` function. `labels` is a list of labels, in order, to pass to `format()` function. Label values will be normalized before being passed to `format()` so they will be identical to how they appear in `id`. Default is {} (`descriptors` output will be empty).
sections.title: descriptor_formats

sections.description: Route53 DNS Zone ID to add hostname records for Elasticsearch domain and Kibana
sections.title: dns_zone_id

sections.description: Whether or not to require HTTPS
sections.title: domain_endpoint_options_enforce_https

sections.description: The name of the TLS security policy that needs to be applied to the HTTPS endpoint
sections.title: domain_endpoint_options_tls_security_policy

sections.description:
Explicit flag to enable creating a DNS hostname for ES.

If `true`, then `var.dns_zone_id` is required.
sections.title: domain_hostname_enabled

sections.description:
The baseline input/output (I/O) performance of EBS volumes attached to data nodes.

Applicable only for the Provisioned IOPS EBS volume type
sections.title: ebs_iops

sections.description: EBS volumes for data storage in GB
sections.title: ebs_volume_size

sections.description: Storage type of EBS volumes
sections.title: ebs_volume_type

sections.description: The name of the subdomain for Elasticsearch in the DNS zone (_e.g._ `elasticsearch`, `ui`, `ui-es`, `search-ui`)
sections.title: elasticsearch_subdomain_name

sections.description: Set to false to prevent the module from creating any resources
sections.title: enabled

sections.description: Whether to enable encryption at rest
sections.title: encrypt_at_rest_enabled

sections.description:
The KMS key ID to encrypt the Elasticsearch domain with.

If not specified, then it defaults to using the AWS/Elasticsearch service KMS key
sections.title: encrypt_at_rest_kms_key_id

sections.description:
ID element.

Usually used for region e.g. 'uw2', 'us-west-2', OR role 'prod', 'staging', 'dev', 'UAT'
sections.title: environment

sections.description: Execution role ARN for the module instance
sections.title: execution_role_arn

sections.description: Whether the cluster is highly available and has master nodes and placement in 3 AZs or not
sections.title: highly_available

sections.description: List of actions to allow for the IAM roles, _e.g._ `es:ESHttpGet`, `es:ESHttpPut`, `es:ESHttpPost`
sections.title: iam_actions

sections.description: List of IAM role ARNs to permit to assume the Elasticsearch user role
sections.title: iam_authorizing_role_arns

sections.description: List of IAM role ARNs to permit access to the Elasticsearch domain
sections.title: iam_role_arns

sections.description:
The maximum session duration (in seconds) for the user role.

Can have a value from 1 hour to 12 hours
sections.title: iam_role_max_session_duration

sections.description: The ARN of the permissions boundary policy which will be attached to the Elasticsearch user role
sections.title: iam_role_permissions_boundary

sections.description:
Limit `id` to this many characters (minimum 6).

Set to `0` for unlimited length.

Set to `null` for keep the existing setting, which defaults to `0`.

Does not affect `id_full`.
sections.title: id_length_limit

sections.description:
End number for allowed port range.

(e.g. `443`)
sections.title: ingress_port_range_end

sections.description:
Start number for allowed port range.

(e.g. `443`)
sections.title: ingress_port_range_start

sections.description: Number of data nodes in the cluster
sections.title: instance_count

sections.description: Elasticsearch instance type for data nodes in the cluster
sections.title: instance_type

sections.description:
Explicit flag to enable creating a DNS hostname for Kibana.

If `true`, then `var.dns_zone_id` is required.
sections.title: kibana_hostname_enabled

sections.description: The name of the subdomain for Kibana in the DNS zone (_e.g._ `kibana`, `ui`, `ui-es`, `search-ui`, `kibana.elasticsearch`)
sections.title: kibana_subdomain_name

sections.description:
The order in which the labels (ID elements) appear in the `id`.

Defaults to ["namespace", "environment", "stage", "name", "attributes"].

You can omit any of the 6 labels ("tenant" is the 6th), but at least one must be present.
sections.title: label_order

sections.description: ARN of the CloudWatch log group to which log for ES_APPLICATION_LOGS needs to be published
sections.title: log_publishing_application_cloudwatch_log_group_arn

sections.title: log_publishing_application_enabled

sections.description: ARN of the CloudWatch log group to which log for AUDIT_LOGS needs to be published

sections.title: log_publishing_index_cloudwatch_log_group_arn

sections.title: log_publishing_index_enabled

sections.title: log_publishing_search_enabled

Usually the component or solution name, e.g. 'app' or 'jenkins'.

There is no tag with the value of the `name` input.
